intro: Cacalia alpestris, commonly known as the alpine cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, high-altitude conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, hairy, and arranged in a rosette, while its flowers are small and clustered in a flat head. Cacalia alpestris is often found in meadows and grasslands at elevations above 1,500 meters.
